metadata.name: Sysmon Discovery Via Default Driver Altitude Using Findstr.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects usage of "findstr" with the argument "385201". Which could indicate potential discovery of an installed Sysinternals Sysmon service using the default driver altitude (even if the name is changed).

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\find.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\findstr.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('find\.exe', 'findstr\.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' 385201')))

output.summary: Detects usage of "findstr" with the argument "385201". Which could indicate potential discovery of an installed Sysinternals Sysmon service using the default driver altitude (even if the name is changed).
